title: OpenProject Enterprise Features Review: Enhanced Capabilities for Organizations
content: OpenProject is an open-source project management software designed to support traditional, agile, and hybrid project management methodologies. It offers robust capabilities for project planning, time tracking, collaborative documentation, and issue tracking. OpenProject provides both cloud and on-premises enterprise editions, building upon its free Community edition with enhanced features, security, and support. Key features of OpenProject's enterprise editions include enhanced security, with Enterprise Cloud offering secure hosting in EU data centers, redundant infrastructure, continuous encrypted data backups, and regular data privacy assessments. The On-premises edition provides full data sovereignty and control over your environment. Enterprise Add-ons include advanced task management tools, intelligent workflows, custom themes, team planners, action boards, notifications for upcoming and overdue tasks, a search tool, graphs for visualizing progress, and custom fields. Comprehensive support from OpenProject experts is a hallmark of Enterprise plans, covering installation, upgrades, technical, and functional support. Advanced project planning features like full baseline comparison (comparing changes with any date range) and advanced resource management for workload visualization and distribution across projects are also part of the Enterprise version. OpenProject's open-source nature allows for customization and integration with other systems via its API, supporting bidirectional data flows with tools like Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, Slack, and Microsoft Teams. An Enterprise BIM Cloud edition is available, offering powerful BIM collaboration features, BCF management, and an IFC viewer. Benefits of the enterprise editions include complete control over data, flexibility to review or modify the software, and a high level of security and extensibility. Users appreciate its ability to organize every phase of production, visualize timelines, track tasks, and facilitate seamless collaboration. When compared to tools like Jira, OpenProject is highlighted for its open-source nature and continued offering of both cloud and on-premises deployment options. OpenProject's enterprise pricing varies, with plans like Enterprise Cloud and Enterprise On-premises available, and other pricing tiers like Basic, Professional, and Premium.
